column1: How do you think your Replika chatbot would impact you, positively or negatively?

column1: I would speak to my chatbot whenever I'm feeling low and when I need to boost my self-esteem. I would also speak to my chatbot and ask for advice on topics I'm unsure about. I would speak to them whenever I'm feeling lonely. So this would impact me positively.

column1: I think it would be negative as you would be less likely to talk to real people or know how to appropriately interact with them.

column1: Positively, would be like having an interactive journal and reactions

column1: From a guidance point of view then I think the Replika chatbot could have a positive impact i.e. if you were looking for what would be another person's perspective on an issue without actually talking to a human being.  It would have a negative impact on me if I became to reliant on the Replika chatbot and reduced my interactions with humans. I would like to try the chatbot but I'm not sure it's something I would use on a regular basis.
column2: I suppose it would boil down to how lonely or in need of companionship you actually were and whether talking to a chatbot would be better than not having anyone to talk to.
column3: I feel there are definitely pros and cons for chatbots so it will be interesting to see how 'big' they become.

column1: I think it could be a useful resource if I had a problem or situation that, for whatever reason,  I felt needed a response from someone that wouldn't be emotionally impacted by the discussion as I worry about upsetting people or making them uncomfortable, sometimes, by expressing emotions that I need to work through. As such a resource, I think it would impact me positively.  I don't think it's a substitute for real interactions, though, and although I very much doubt I would use one much, if I did and came to rely on AI as my primary means of emotional support, I think it would adversely impact my relationships with other people.
column2: I think they can have their place as long as they are used as a tool to self-awareness and working through of problems, but the concept is open to abuse and that over-reliance on such AI could have an extremely harmful effect on certain people.
column3: AI is only as good as those who program it, and in a world where people's reliance on technology is becoming ever more unquestioning, perhaps there should be some areas of life that are *not* subject to it.

column1: Possibly positively for a short term in a crisis, however it would impact me negatively in the long term with continued use.
column2: Uncomfortable as they are not real. It seems risky.
column3: Would need to know a huge amount more about safety, data use and similar.

column1: I feel it would be a distraction that would have a negative impact on my busy life
column2: i imagine its good if you are lonely and crave human contact

column1: If I became too dependent on Replika it would have negative implications on my social intelligence and I wouldn’t feel the need to interact with other humans
column2: I think they are very harmful as it disincentivises people from making human relationships

column1: I've interacted with enough chatbots and AI software to not let it impact me much. Partly for that reason, I wouldn't spend much time interacting with it, so there wouldn't be much of a positive or negative impact.

Personally I wouldn't be able to get past the knowledge that it's a computer program owned by a corporation, with all the inbuilt biases that come with such ownership. I'd rather interact with real humans if at all possible.
column3: There are many things AI can help us with. Science appears to be trying to use it to replace many of the things that make life worth living (friendship, art creation, writing creation). I'd rather we had AI to do our taxes and clean our hallway!

column1: I think it would affect me negatively because it would never come up with a satisfactory answer if something was wrong, and I'd never be happy with the quality of the conversation. It'd be like a partner who never listens.
column2: Such mixed feelings. Generally I think of chatbots as not being real enough so they can't answer your questions (e.g. if you contact a customer services chatbot, they can only answer questions that are already in the FAQ and can't find anything further out). But if they were too real, I'd be really freaked out and would wonder if a real person was listening in somewhere and typing the answers.

column1: I could perhaps gain some helpful tips from it about how to deal with some situations in my life or how to plan out a plan of action or such. This would be definitely helpful if it help out. On the other hand, using it more and more often would probably lead to me wasting more time, instead of concentrating on more important, real-life things
column2: I think they can be useful with providing advice, help or suggestions but since they are still a bunch of 0s and 1s still, I just don't care about it as much, especially in terms of actual relationships, as they would all feel artificial and fake. I guess being able to have an actual intelligent and realistic conversations about specific topics like computing, chemistry etc. could be useful and great.

column1: To be honest, I think a little bit of both. I think my self esteem would be reduced. I can absolutely see the logic and potential for some people, especially those who are lonely, but I just don't think it would suit me personally.
column2: Again, I can absolutely see how they could be of great benefit to some, but to me personally, I think it could be somewhat damaging. Each to his own, so I certainly wouldn't judge those who feel it helps them in some way.

column1: I think it could be positive to have "someone" to talk to and be able to ask questions of.  However, I think overall, it would be detrimental to become dependent on an AI.  I think it could negatively impact my relationships with humans.

column1: positive if it gave good suggestions but negatively if used for personal interaction instead of real contact

column1: I feel like it may be a bad replacement for real human interaction. There are certainly some interesting things that can be done but I don't think there would be that much positively. Perhaps I just see past the curtain too much and find it completely artificial and disingenuous

column1: I think the chatbot would impact me positively, by giving me a way to talk things out and figure out things from a difference perspective. So I think it would be good on a moderate basis but in now way should I be talking to a bot on an every day, multiple times of day basis.
column2: I think they are good in some respects and bad in others. My previous response is exactly why they can be both. It could help tons of people who are house bound or in need of someone to talk to so in that respect it is great. But I also think people would end up believing in this AI type of life and its not real so believing in it could be damaging.

column3: Sure! If you like art or anything like that, I create it and sell it.

column2: I love the idea, it's nice to talk to someone, even if it's just a bot who has any idea what I'm talking about.

column1: Negatively. It would distract me from real interactions with people.
column2: I think they are pretty harmful. They distract from the real world and push people to get advice from AI and not human wisdom.

column1: Overall negatively; it would distract me from growing relationships with real humans
column2: I think they’re not a good alternative to human relationships

column1: I think it could give helpful advice and that is what I would use it for. A resource. But not develop feelings for it like a human who lives and breaths.
column2: I think it's good for people who can't have normal social interaction or romantic interaction but crave that basic need.
column3: I think the tech is great and it is the future - I'm curious to see what it becomes

column1: I think that would depend on how it had been programmed.
column2: I think it’s interesting and, like many things, could be a positive or a negative thing. It seems that there could be many variables which could shape potential interactions.
column3: The thought of this really makes you think.

column1: I think it would impact me negatively if I used it a lot because I might become reliant on it and not interact with actual people.
column2: I think they can be good for small things, but not good if used as a romantic partner or a friend.

column1: It will impact me positively because it will make my activities much easier
